Find your future with us.The Boeing Company is seeking a Lead Communications & Networks Waveform Engineer (Level 4) is needed for several Phantom Works programs at the El Segundo, CA location.Position ResponsibilitiesDesigning and implementing advanced wireless communication systems and waveforms.Designing signal processing algorithms of modern communication waveforms including advanced signal processing techniques (eg, parasitic signal cancelation, MIMO processing, diversity combining).Working with signal processing development tools including Matlab and Simulink.Implement architectures in FPGA or other device firmwareThis position requires the ability to obtain a US Security Clearance for which the US Government requires US Citizenship.  An interim and/or final U.S. secret clearance Post Start is required. Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study in an engineering discipline.5+ years of experience designing and implementing advanced wireless communication systems and waveforms.Experience designing signal processing algorithms of modern communication waveforms including advanced signal processing techniques.Experience with signal processing development tools including Matlab and Simulink.Experience implementing waveforms on the modern hardware including FPGAs, DSPs, SoCs and RFoCs.Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):Ability to maintain DoD security clearance.Understanding design specifics of modern military waveforms.Familiarity with AJ, LPI/LPD and SIGINT aspects of the waveform design.Ability to prototype software using modern algorithmic and scripting languages (C, C++, Python).Familiarity with design principles of modern wireless datalink and networking layers.Experience developing custom device drivers and kernel modules for the Linux operating system?Typical Education/Experience:Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+4 years' related work experience, Master+7 years' related work experience). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.Relocation:Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.Shift:This is a first shift position:Drug-Free Workplace:Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.Qualifications
